name: Union Trust Company of Pittsburgh's Petition
name_abbreviation: Union Trust Co. of Pittsburgh's Petition

judges: Before Schaffer, C. J., Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
parties: Union Trust Company of Pittsburgh’s Petition.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam;
• The decree of the court below, setting aside the order of the Pennsylvania Labor Relations Board, is affirmed on the foregoing excerpts from the opinion of the court below, at the cost of appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam;

attorneys: J. Charles Short, Solicitor, with him M. Louise Rutherford, Deputy Attorney General, and Claude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellant..
James S. Beal, Jr., with him Reed, Smith, Shaw & MeClay, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Union Trust Company of Pittsburgh’s Petition.
Argued May 26, 1941.
Before Schaffer, C. J., Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
J. Charles Short, Solicitor, with him M. Louise Rutherford, Deputy Attorney General, and Claude T. Reno, Attorney General, for appellant..
James S. Beal, Jr., with him Reed, Smith, Shaw & MeClay, for appellee.
